p: These licensed species used in the Brazilian traditional medicine are: (1) Cordia curassavica, used as anti-inflammatory; (2) Croton heliotropiifolius, stimulant; (3) Lantana camara and (4) Mikania glomerata, expectorant; (5) Passiflora alata, as anxiolytic, sedative and expectorante; (6) Schinus terebinthifolia, anti-infective and healing; (7) Solanum paniculatum, cholagogue, choleretic and hepatoprotective (Carvalho et al. 2018).
